intro: Persea pseudofasciculata var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered persimmon, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Central America. It belongs to the Lauraceae family, which includes laurels and avocado trees. The plant features glossy, ovate leaves and produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters.
